title_sort: louisa van velsor whitman to walt whitman, [28 november to 12 december 1868]
title: Louisa Van Velsor Whitman to Walt Whitman, [28 November to 12 December 1868]
text: 5 Dec 68saturdaySaturday eveningWalter deari write a few lines to say i received a letter from heydeHeyde yesterday they all jeffJeff and all set in for me to send the letter to you and i thought i would last night but to day i thought better of it i thought it would only put you out of temper as it did all of us) he first began with saying hannaHannah was so she came out to the kichenkitchen and eat her meals but she is very far from complete recovery she is very frail constitutionally yet her hand or rather her thumb by what he says is quite bad and the flesh scrinksshrinks from the bone) this may all be true probably is) then he goes on to say that she is better off with him that any change would not benefit her or to that affect with his highfullatinhighfulatin phrases) well now for the second act) he says he received a very stupid letter from Walt addressed to han which he humanely concluded not to deliver to her and then he goes on to quote the first part of the letter he says it ran thus) i suppose my dear sister you are by this time perfectly recovered and the next) what a stupid man and the balance he says is about nothing himself stuff i am out of patience let him stay in washingtonWashington he has but small credit here i dontdon't want to see him)all this i have copied from his letter except where i marked above now walterWalter what doodo you think such a man is capable of doing i hope you have or will write to the Doctor and if you can go on there i should be glad mattyMatty says she makes no doubt the letter he kept from her was the one you spoke of her getting well enoughfenough when you came that she could come back with you i shall write to her and i shall write to him he is a very bad man very very but Walter dontdon't lets think of him if han was away from him i should never want to hear his name again) we are having quite a snow storm to day here Jeffy and mattyMatty did think of going to Boston on mondayMonday next they will go to st louisSt. Louis is a couple of weeks it will be much the best for them and i shall be releivedrelieved of a great care they will board marthaMartha is better than when she came but she cantcan't doodo much the children is trouble enoughfenough there is three girls down stairs and a jolly houshouse we have i tell you i am pretty well but get almost worked downwalt if you should get any wine send or take it if you go to han) write so i can get it tuesdayTuesday and i will write again good bie walterWalter dear Louisa Van Velsor Whitman to Walt Whitman, [28 November to 12 December 1868]
